Person B: Sure . First of all , it ' s very important for you not to be late . Job interviewers usually don ' t think very highly of a candidate who arrives ten minutes after the appointed time , only to explain that he could not find the place or that there was heavy traffic .
Person A: Yeah , that's very important .
Person B: So you ' d better explore the place the day before and at the same time , look around to see what the employees are wearing . So the next day you will arrive early for the appointment .
Person A: I ' ll try my best to make a good impression on the interviewer .
Person B: That ' s right . You need to create a good image in a limited time , usually about 30 to 45 minutes .
Person A: It ' s always easier to say something than to do it .
Person B: It ' s not too difficult to make a good impression . For example , you should take care to appear well-groomed and modestly dressed . Avoid the extremes of a too elaborate or too casual style . This will put you on the same level as other applicants and make the interviewer consider more important qualifications .
Person A: But I love wearing T-shirts and jeans .
Person B: I advise you not to wear a too casual style when going to an interview . Informal clothes as well as torn jeans and dirty shoes convey the impression that you are not serious about the job , or that you may be casual about your work as you are about your clothes .
Person A: It ' s a pity that I cannot afford more expensive clothes .
Person B: You misunderstood me . Clothes which are too colorful or too expensive suggest that you do not understand what behavior is appropriate for the job , or that you are snobbish or frivolous .
Person A: I know what you mean . I ought to wear right clothes at the right time .
Person B: You got it . Only in this way can you gain the respect of the interviewer and his confidence in your judgement .
Person A:
label: it seems that'clothes make the man ' .
you are so right .
i know , but i wish i could get an expensive suit just so i can have it for more interviews
that 's true . thanks for the advice
i understand . thank you .
response: Aye, good George, thy counsel I shall heed, for in the garb of modesty and grace, I shall present myself to yon employer's gaze. In timely manner and with due respect, I'll strive to win their favor and their trust.
